required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study for Incidence of Proximal Junctional Kyphosis Between Parathyroid Hormone and Denosumab Following Adult Spinal Deformity Surgery : A Prospective, Randomized Controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Study for Incidence of Proximal Junctional Kyphosis Between Parathyroid Hormone and Denosumab Following Adult Spinal Deformity Surgery : A Prospective, Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Medical therapy that can lower PJK rates are also being sought. Teriparatide (TP), a recombinant human parathyroid hormone (PTH 1-34), is a bone forming agent mainly used to treat osteoporotic patients with high risk of osteoporotic fracture. There has been reports suggesting protective effect of prophylactic TP to osteoporotic patients receiving ASD surgery concerning PJK.6 Although it had limitations of small sample size and surgical selection bias owing to study design being retrospective. We hypothesized prophylactic TP would act as to reduce the incidence of PJK and therefore reduce PJF and necessity of revision surgeries in patients after ASD correction surgery. Our study can consolidate the beneficial effect of prophylactic TP to patients receiving ASD surgery by reducing the incidence of PJK.

intervention.description: Patients were administered 20mcg of TP (Forsteo) subcutaneously once a day from the day between before 3months to after 3months about surgery.
Patients were administered 60mg of denosumab (Prolia) subcutaneously once 6months from the day on before 3months to after 3months about surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Female patients between 50 years to 80 years of age with ASD
2. Multilevel instrumented fusion
3. Cobb angle above 25̊ in coronal plane deformities, Lumbar lordosis below 20̊ in sagittal plane deformities
4. Minimum follow-up of 1 years
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Diagnosis being tumor or infectious condition like Tb spondylitis were excluded
2. Patients with adverse reactions or contraindications to TP were excluded; side effects to TP or bone cancer or metastasis
